CARDINAL . Under LAW of Book II of ORG , once the claimant has appeared and confirmed that he wishes to bring an action the judge must give the defendant , if he so requests , time equivalent to CARDINAL hearings ( corresponding to DATE ) to reply and raise objections .
CARDINAL . Under LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE ,
( a ) NORP evidence may be adduced by the parties , both at first instance and on appeal , during CARDINAL time - limited stages , divided up as follows :
( i ) CARDINAL termini probatori , each lasting for CARDINAL consecutive hearings ( DATE ) ;
( ii ) CARDINAL termini reprobatori , each lasting for CARDINAL consecutive hearings ;
( iii ) a termine di controprova , lasting for CARDINAL consecutive hearings ;

( b ) the termini probatori , the termini reprobatori and the termine di controprova are opened by the judge at the request of the most diligent party , in succession , when all the evidence adduced in the previous stages has been admitted , or when the time allowed for those stages has been waived or has expired ;

( c ) termini probatori can be waived unilaterally by the claimant ; termini reprobatori can be waived by the defendant only ; the termine di controprova can not be waived except with the consent of all parties ;

( d ) the termine ad allegare ( the time - limited stage for the filing of the parties’ final submissions ) is opened by the judge at the request of the most diligent party ; it lasts for DATE . Once the time allowed for the parties to file their final submissions has expired , the registry transmits the file to the judge within DATE . The judge , of his own motion , sets down a hearing at which judgment will be reserved and keeps the file with a view to reaching his decision ;
( e ) the judge gives his decision within DATE of the hearing at which he reserves judgment .
CARDINAL . Title LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE ( the “ Sole law on the renting of immovable property ” ) contains the following procedural rules :
Section CARDINAL
( Jurisdiction of the Commissario della legge )

“ Disputes about the level of rent , termination of the lease at or before the end of its term or failure to comply with its conditions fall in the first instance within the jurisdiction of the PERSON della legge .
Judicial proceedings must be preceded by an attempt to reach a friendly settlement conducted by the Commissario della legge .
Judgments are immediately enforceable even in the event of an appeal , save where the Commissario della legge decides otherwise .
Judgments concerning the level of rent take effect between the parties immediately .

The Commissario della legge , after considering the application for an eviction order and assessing the grounds advanced , may order immediate enforcement of such a measure within the time specified . ”
Section CARDINAL
( Delayed payment by the tenant )

“ In the event of a delay in payment , at the first hearing of the termination proceedings the judge may , if requested to do so , allow the tenant not DATE to put matters right . Payment of arrears of rent , service charges , statutory interest and costs shall prevent termination of the lease .
The period of grace mentioned in the first paragraph may be granted to the tenant only once in any DATE period . ”
Section CARDINAL
( Date of execution )

“ Where , in his decision , the judge orders the tenant to vacate the premises , he shall , after taking into account the arguments of the opposing parties , fix the date of enforcement not DATE after the date on which the decision itself takes effect . ”
